article_title: Hospitals Ordered To Halt 'Extraordinary' Debt Collection -- For Now

article_metadata.description: Not-for-profit hospitals must cease "extraordinary" debt collection unless it can demonstrate that a patient does not qualify for financial assistance. Nonprofit hospitals across the country have been waiting for more than 18 months for the IRS to make a final decision on regulations the agency proposed under section 501(c)3 that would restrict how patient medical debt can be collected.
article_metadata.author: insidePatientFinance
